website_summaries.verdict: It's not the most elegant mouse, nor does it feel worth the $130 price, but Razer's Naga Epic and its built-in, 12-button keypad could help gamers and others gain mastery over MMOs and other applications with complicated control schemes.
pros: The Razer Naga Epic wireless gaming mouse features a 12-button thumb-side keypad, a 5,600dpi laser sensor, customizable pinkie-side inserts, and LED backlighting
cons: Using those 12 buttons well takes some getting used to, and the mouse doesn't offer quite as much value as competing high-end gaming mice

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Double-click issue!
customer_reviews.text: The switches in these are cheap and you WILL have the dreaded "double-click" issue before long. Contrary to popular belief, this is NOT caused by static buildup. Mine lasted a whole six months. Blowing into the gap under the button will help temporarily, but doesn't excuse the poor construction. This issue happened on my Razer Naga Trinity, as well, both within six months of purchase. If Razer doesn't address this issue in future models, I will never purchase one of these again. If it weren't for this problem, I would love this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Slack

customer_reviews.title: This mouse has been a big disappointment to me for several reasons
customer_reviews.text: I am a big Razer fan; I have been using their keyboards and mice for about 8 years now (almost as long as they have been a company). This mouse has been a big disappointment to me for several reasons. 1. Battery Life is not very long. - If you forget to charge it, it will die the next day. 2. Tracking is not what I have come to expect from Razer - I regularly have problems where the mouse will only move left and right or get stuck and not move Pros - I love the customize-able grip
customer_reviews.author: Rau

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for seven years already and for the first 4 years I've used it everyday for gaming, and I say I loved it. Up until now it still works with no problem at all. All the buttons still works for me. The only thing is the cable. Its like the wool surrounding it is loosening and to protect it I covered it with cable protector.
customer_reviews.author: Cy

customer_reviews.title: Missing everything....
customer_reviews.text: I have just received my item today and it was missing everything. Only thing within the package was the mouse itself and the charging dock. This did not come straight from the factory manufacturer. The following is suppose to be included with original packaging:  Razer Naga Epic Elite MMO Gaming Mouse  3 Interchangeable Side Panels  Charging Dock  Lithium-Ion Polymer Battery  USB Cable  Grid Trainer  Quick Start Guide  Master Guide Again I received only the mouse and the charging dock only. I shall change my rating after I have receive an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: If I would have known the wireless function of this mouse only works when it feels like it I definitely wouldn't have purchased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse to replace my Razer Death Adder that I've had for YEARS. If I would have known the wireless function of this mouse only works when it feels like it I definitely wouldn't have purchased the epic model. I'll be in the middle of a game and the mouse will just completely stop working! have to switch to wired mode to get it going again. This seems to be a common complaint among people who have this mouse and there doesn't appear to be a fix. Razor blames the cable and the mouse, sends a new one only to deal with the same crap. Severely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ronaldo Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Awful.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third razer naga mouse I've had. With every mouse, the same problem occurs. It will stop working at random, and will only respond to clicks and not scrolling. I just received this mouse today and it worked fine for about an hour, and then the same thing happened as what happened to the last two. I don't know why razer products get so much hype when they're awful. I've purchased $20 mouses from Walmart that last years and they never give me problems. This is the last razer product I'll ever purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laceface

customer_reviews.title: Workstation Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I use this mouse for AutoCAD and the programmable thumb keys are perfect and function flawlessly every time. Despite it's purple color in the picture, it has spectrum cycling. The color cycling is not as crisp as the Deathadder Chroma, nor does this mouse have Razer mousepad calibration like the Deathadder. I haven't really tested the wireless range yet, but it was fully functional at 6 feet the other day. Customer Service on my previous Nagas was excellent, so I didn't hesitate to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr TheUS

customer_reviews.title: It's OK. The problem is that it needs to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's OK. The problem is that it needs to be charged and when I forgot to charge it at night it died half way through the next day. It will run with the cord plugged in, but so will the corded version. You have to remember to flip a switch when you want to charge it and if you forget it just sits there in the charger. The wired version also has a newer button layout that I think makes using the buttons much easier. I prefer the wired version.
customer_reviews.author: Peter from Doylestown

customer_reviews.title: A good mouse with a lot of buttons, not as useful as I expected it to be.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good mouse, but not as usable as I expected it would be for playing World of Warcraft. For me it was not as intuitive as I thought I would be. I ultimately ended up programming all the buttons for forwards and backwards and ultimately replaced the mouse with another gaming mouse. I would recommend trying before buying, if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: This mouse was a huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I first got this mouse and it was great. Then it started randomly freezing and disconnecting. Didn't happen too often but whatever. Then the wired feature stopped working so I could only use wireless. Whatever. I only use wireless anyways, just kind of a pain now I can't use it. Now it just doesn't work period. What a piece of s***. I'm never buying a wireless gaming mouse from Razer ever again after this. I'll try any other brand but not Razer, which sucks because I had a death adder forever and loved it, but this thing is just a joke. Way too unreliable. My suggestion is to avoid this product entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Conklin

customer_reviews.title: More than worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing mouse, one of the best on the market for years. If you like extra buttons on your mouse then this thing is the way to go. Even if your not using it for gaming and your just a power user that needs some macro or shortcut keys its a great solution to give you some extra options. The software is a bit over the top but the options it offers are well worth the extra "fluff" it has.
customer_reviews.author: bakan723

customer_reviews.title: The 12 buttons are in a comfortable position that you don't have to stretch your fingers
customer_reviews.text: I use this mouse for playing World Of Warcraft. The width of the mouse is spot on for my size hand. Even though it comes with attachments to make it wider, i did not need them. The 12 buttons are in a comfortable position that you don't have to stretch your fingers. I bought this mouse to replace my old Epic Razer that failed after 4 years of solid use. This wireless version is just as good quality as the old wired one. The bonus of this mouse is that you can use it wired or wireless. I would highly recommend this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Moore

customer_reviews.title: ... RGB lighting compliments my setup +12 MMO buttons are awesome if you run out of key binds in an ...
customer_reviews.text: +Nice RGB lighting compliments my setup +12 MMO buttons are awesome if you run out of key binds in an MMO, or if you have a lot of custom macros. +Lots of molds fit my hand well -The lift off distance is annoyingly high -The wireless seems to come and go -The battery life doesn't seem to last the full advertised duration I'm going back to the Death Adder on my next mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouse (plagued by hit-and-miss software that sells your data ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mouse (plagued by hit-and-miss software that sells your data and seems to pick and choose when its going to work properly (and has no alternative)) that has good build quality and a very useful button layout. Be warned that the learning curve for this mouse is several hours of gaming and that at first the side grid will feel awful. This is normal: your hand will learn to accommodate it, and once it does, you will NEVER want to go back to a regular mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse, does everything right. I really like the color changing it goes through, very subtle changes through a wide spectrum of colors. Gets a lot of attention for that alone, but easily switches from corded to cordless as well. Holds a good charge, have had no issues with that. If you are a gamer definitely check this out, the 12 thumb buttons are awesome for skill bars in games. Takes a bit of getting used too for sure ( I thought I hated it for the first 3 days) but it becomes second nature real quick. I have always bought razer products and I will continue to do so!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Control
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my gamer boyfriend. The first one we purchased died after 20 days, I believe we just got a 'bad mouse' and the battery stopped holding a charge. Otherwise this mouse is great, the wireless last a very long time, and will sound a beep when it is close to dying so you can easily plug it in while playing or place it on the charger. The colors are vibrant and its very sleek looking. Hoping the second one doesn't have problems but Amazon quickly sent us a new one, we sent the old back and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Carrala

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: Most wireless accessories are 2.4ghz, this is 3.5 No lag from movement or clicks.. it's instant. It's the best mouse you can buy for gaming. You can feel the quality when handling it. Haven't found any game specific macros to download, but has an easy to use interface in the synapse software to create them, adjust light colors, etc. Quite a bit to pay for a mouse in general, but it is worth the money it costs.
customer_reviews.author: James Hinman

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but got worse over time.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few months, and looked awesome. Then it would disconnect randomly when on wireless and would lose vertical movement from time to time. Got to the point where I could not rely on the mouse, so it is now sitting in a desk drawer while I use a quality logitech. Thought all the buttons on the side would be useful, but I was wrong. But that's more of personal preference. Sofware was okay. (Razer Synapse)
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Razer: Skirting Warranties With A Firey Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse was awesome. It was precise, and was not too complicated to map features to the buttons. All was well. Until it caught on fire a week before the two year warranty expired. There is no phone number to reach this company. Only an email customer service system. By the time Razer got around to responding they said that they would looking into replacing, it was past two years, and they decided that it was out of warranty. Even though I contacted them, and the damages took place before the warranty expired.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Really nice mouse, but the battery isn't that great.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the mouse, and the keypad on the side. It's very comfortable and the extras that are included to change the side feel of it are a very nice feature. I understand the LEDs take some electricity, but the battery ended up dead so many times when I would go to use it. Sometimes it doesn't sit just right on the charger and you'll find out it's dead. So I ended up just leaving the cable plugged in on mine. Great mouse though, you can feel that it's an expensive product. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shenhua

customer_reviews.title: Replacement required.
customer_reviews.text: Almost immediately, the first one I ordered would not power on. For whatever reason, my pc would not recognize it. Checked all drivers/firmware and tried other devices. Problem was with this mouse. This replacement was promptly sent and it's worked since. I've had few issues (just stay up to date with firmware/drivers). So far, so good. I have read a lot of negative reviews however, especially concerning the razer customer service. Buyer beware. UPDATE: After about a year or less, the left click started double clicking everything. I've read it requires taking it apart and cleaning the interior. At this point, I simply won't buy Razer products. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me, you can't get fooled again.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in perfect condition and works great
customer_reviews.text: A hard to find product no longer made! Arrived in perfect condition and works great. The new model of this mouse is much wider, for those of us who prefer a smaller mouse to grip this is the one. Comes with interchangeable right sides so you can still choose thickness based on your preference. The ability to charge it for wireless use is very convenient, though it works perfectly like a wired mouse when plugged directly into the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse with connection problems
customer_reviews.text: I am unfortunately returning this mouse. I have had a Razer Naga for quite a while and really liked it. The extra buttons are very nice and the mouse fits my hand nicely. The problem is the wireless part. This mouse loses the connection several times a day with no warning. I upgraded drivers and tried to upgrade the firmware but the program had problems seeing the mouse. I contacted razer customer service and they were very good about trying to help but it is just too much trouble. I'll just have to be content with my wired naga.
customer_reviews.author: Danny McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can have the mouse wired or wireless. Keep in mind that you have to charge the mouse after a day but this is easy to just place on the docking station. I purchased the mouse because I want to improve my healing in the World of Warcraft on-line game. Takes a little getting use to hitting buttons and what spells belong to each button since you have so many to choose from on the mouse. Healing has increased and I am able to react to situations must faster now. Software is very easy to use to set-up your macros and spells. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lor Lor

customer_reviews.title: Already Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Only have had this mouse for an hour and already love it! I'm a huge Razer fan and have a lot of their product but this one takes the cake. Windows 10 broke the Bluetooth on my laptop and I was unable to use my Razer mouse that had Bluetooth. This one correct can be wired or wireless but takes up a USB port in either situation. This one works well with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Love This Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I had this mouse for 5 years before it finally started wearing (missing clicks, double clicks, etc.). This is an excellent mouse and the interchangable sides makes sure it fits your hand perfectly. Light colors are entirely customizable, or there are a few pre-set options as well. I would definitely buy this mouse again, but I'm upgrading to the chroma version this time.
customer_reviews.author: Aja J.

customer_reviews.title: Please make them again!
customer_reviews.text: After years it finally started double clicking in sad they don’t make these anymore
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing. These side panels don't stay on! ...
customer_reviews.text: So disappointing. These side panels don't stay on!! I have carpel tunnel and only one of the 3 side panels truly didn't aggravate my condition, but they kept falling off and I ended up losing them over time. I contacted razer to ask to buy a replacement and they said they don't carry cosmetic parts...... This isn't cosmetic!! This makes the mouse unusable for me!!! I'm now researching similar products made by their competitors so I can continue my gaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole C

customer_reviews.title: better than standard naga
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. Love the added weight of the battery in comparison to the regular naga. I adjusted quickly to the buttons. It also has notches on certain buttons to help. The micro USB cable that came with mine had a short - hence 4 stars instead of 5. Razer support was awesome and replaced it for free, did not even charge for shipping. Was a little slow responding, but not bad.
customer_reviews.author: MPH

customer_reviews.title: Best Gaming Mouse, Hands Down !
customer_reviews.text: The Razer Naga is the absolute best mouse I have ever owned. The feel, the weight, the comfort, the functionally, the customization, nearly everything about this mouse is perfect. It works as a corded or a wireless mouse. The only slight complaint is the battery life could be better, but it is not that bad. Under heavy use it last about a day, it most likely would last much longer if you turned off or dimmed the lights , but it is just so good looking with them on I never turned them off.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Epic!
customer_reviews.text: Epic is a good name for this mouse. I absolutely love this mouse. I would tell any gamer to get this mouse because of the utility and definitely gives you an advantage when compared to a normal mouse. I give this mouse 5 stars because its awesome to me but I will say that a person with larger hands may have not use this mouse as easily. The set-up was nice and easy also. I use the wireless mode more than the corded one but it functions well both ways. If yourself still on the fence about this mouse like I was then I will tell you that I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Adonis K Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: POS! Watch Out!
customer_reviews.text: I like roughly 1/5th of the reviewers wanted this product to work really badly but it's terrible software, construction and hardware make it nothing but a lemon you cannot even drink from. It's the worst. Razer support is a joke. My only hope is that Amazon will take it back. Problems: Constant 0% battery issue even when plugged in. When connection does happen it doesn't move the mouse. Hardly ever pairs correctly. Just doesn't work. Pros: Would be awesome, if it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Thayer

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Feels lot like the older Razer Naga except has cordless option built-in. Tried it wired and wireless and works great so far. Can't speak on reliability because have only had it for short time but so far haven't had any issues and the fit is what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Jayce

customer_reviews.title: it's perfect to play with full macro bind to WoW
customer_reviews.text: I was a Razer fan for so many time, but I am completely disapointed because my mouse's eye bugged after 10 months. Was already loosing paint on the buttons after 5 Months. Nevertheless, it's perfect to play with full macro bind to WoW.
customer_reviews.author: hijitita

customer_reviews.title: When it works a 5 but breaks like a cheap 4 dollar mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mouse I have ever owned, until it broke exactly 1 month past warranty. All of the buttons died but the mouse still moved. You would think with spending this kind of money on an item, it would be built to last. My last mouse a Microsoft 1000 laser mouse still works after years of use, and thank goodness I still had it while I ordered a new gaming mouse. I will never spend a dime on Razer products ever again. Overpriced and not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Berberette

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I own a lot of Razer products and I really enjoy them. I upgraded from a corded Naga to the wireless epic. I really enjoyed the cordless freedom, for a few hours. I let the battery charge overnight but on use the next morning, it died after 90 minutes. Then after recharging again, the mouse would freeze like the laser died, the buttons would work but the mouse wouldn't move. I RMA'ed it for an exchange. I'll write an update if the new one works out. Meanwhile my old cordless Mamba is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Play an MMO? Thinking about a new mouse? This one is worth it. It comes with 'trainers' that you can stick on the buttons for easier finger placement. Took me about 2 days (of maybe 4 hrs a day) to really get use to it. Now? Now I would hate not having it. Holy crap, how did I think it was acceptable to be doing finger yoga for hours just playing my games? No more weird alt key combinations or whatever you might not specifically like when you've ran out of the normal hot keys.
customer_reviews.author: roark

customer_reviews.title: Razer naga epic
customer_reviews.text: i really like this mouse, it has definatly improved my gaming. it does take some getting used to, but after just a few days using it, you wonder how you managed to play before. i m baad about walking off and not putting it on its cradle, so its always dead the next day. after a cple times of that i pretty much just use it wired. the only thing i dont like about it, is the 2 buttons on top are under the clickwheel-wich i personally dont find very ergonomic, wish they was like to the left of where your index finger goes.
customer_reviews.author: Shantel

customer_reviews.title: The best gaming mouse available
customer_reviews.text: What more can I say. I've been using this mouse for 2 years now and its amazing .. The 12 side buttons all map to abilities in my MMO's that play and the control is amazing .. This is the wireless model and it performs as well as any mouse I've ever used .. Plus it lights up and changes colors .. I would buy this 50 times over. Great mouse. RAZR should just improve upon this mouse and not change anything drastically ..
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse I’ve been using this specific model of naga for many years
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Horrific battery life
customer_reviews.text: When the mouse is working - it's definitely a great mouse. I love the way it looks, I love the feel of it. It's responsive and all around an enjoyable experience. However, the battery life is just abysmal. Literally it will die in just a few hours. I leave it charging all night - every night and it can't even last through the next day. It's utterly depressing because of how great a mouse it is when it works. I'll be returning this and hopefully finding a better wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sol

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gaming Mouse
customer_reviews.text: You can run it wired or wireless, it has every feature of the normal Razer Naga, except the two forward/back buttons are now in a more manageable place. I use this as a daily work mouse and my nightly play mouse. I own a Naga Molten, but I'd say I prefer the Epic. The Epic also has side pieces to fit any size hand or preference. It's hard to beat having all those buttons on the side, no matter which model you choose!
customer_reviews.author: atti

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: It's just okay. I wanted to love it but the performance isn't as flawless as the reviews imply. I can't use it on wireless mode because the connection flakes out--always at the worst times, too. Even wired it sometimes locks up. The programmable buttons are awesome and I love that you can adjust the color. But if I had been able to try it before I bought it I probably would've passed.
customer_reviews.author: JDV

customer_reviews.title: It's a naga!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a naga molten core for my desk top and am totally happy with it. Since I bought a laptop, I wanted the freedom of moving around without having to deal with another cord. This comes with a usb cord to either plug into you mouse to laptop or into the charging base.for charging. For those of you into lightening effects, this one has a range of colors it cycles through or you can select one color.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Thompson

customer_reviews.title: perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Games will be spinning but I didnt buy this for gaming with, I bought it to use at work, I have a reporting program that I spend my day working with and this mouse is awsome. Program your macros into the 12 buttons on the side and it works flawlessly, I really only had a few commands I wanted to use but after I was playing with it I even programmed my password to sync the program in and hit enter. Click on the cursor box and press the "12" button. Done.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse, Ain't worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse, perfect for mmo gaming. Easy on the eyes and comfortable to hold with over 14 buttons to use with a very easy learning curve. However, there are 5 major crippling weaknesses in the product, #1 extremely over priced for a simple wireless upgrade over the razer naga #2 weak build, not robust at all and will almost 80% of the time start to malfunction within 1 - 2 years #3 razer service is non-existent after warranty, they wont even look at your mouse. #4 battery life after a full charge is laughably low. nearly 5- 6 hours will drain it. #5 grip isnt particularly good. While it lasts it will be great, but then.. it wont.
customer_reviews.author: Ario

customer_reviews.title: ... and mouse combo made by Logitech the keyboard was great but the mouse sucked so i picked up this ...
customer_reviews.text: i had purchased a keyboard and mouse combo made by Logitech the keyboard was great but the mouse sucked so i picked up this amazing piece of machinery and after using it for 2 weeks i could never go back to a regular mouse again this is my first time buying a razor product i just wish i could have afforded to buy it sooner
customer_reviews.author: Complete Electronics REPAIR

customer_reviews.title: Battery does not last a full day
customer_reviews.text: Great Mouse. I use it everyday... Wired. I Enjoy a wireless mouse so I tried to use it wireless for the first week. It could not last a full work day, and would have to plug it in. I got tired of having to plug it in everyday and then unplug it when it was charged, so I now just leave it plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: alo

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse I've used so far!
customer_reviews.text: My previous mouse was the Lachesis. The buttons on that mouse were not as comfortable and placed in a way that made them difficult to use. This mouse is angled so that you can use the buttons much easier making them very useful. The mouse can be used either wireless/wired. The cord is made out of a hard lace which is very nice compared to normal cables; very strong. Mouse comes with different sides to make the mouse fit comfortably however you prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: and made LOL more fun to play compared to a standard mouse
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain it is definitely a smooth mouse, and made LOL more fun to play compared to a standard mouse. This is my first and probably the only one i will need for quite a while. Now my did have a defect mouse within like 2 months of actually playing with it, but Razer quickly responded to get me a proper replacement. So with great customer service on the back-end you got nothing to lose.
customer_reviews.author: CanDaMan

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Gaming Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice mouse, It's built well, has great features. I however have had some problems with mine. Right out of the box, I tried rebinding (In Battlefield 3) The Melee button to the mouse key 4. It did not, and has not worked with it. It does weird things like I'll be running around and every 2 seconds it just sits there swing around melee...Which is really frustrating when you shoot 2-3 shots at a guy then someone (not you) switches your gun for your melee weapon.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not worth the extra cost for wireless use
customer_reviews.text: All in all, I'm very happy with this product. The mouse is sturdy and durable. It took me longer to get used to than advertised, but I eventually got the hang of it. I do regret spending so much more for the wireless version. I almost always use the wired option. The battery does not last as long as I'd like and the response is less than ideal in wireless mode. The included software which allows tweaking and reassignment of functions is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for GW2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my gaming laptop and for MMO play as I was a mouse clicker and as I get older find my twitch reflexes slowing a bit. This mouse makes up my deficits. All my hotbar commands on the mouse and after 4-6 play hours I became quite good with it. I wish it used a wireless USB like the Logitech mice because I can't use the recharge stand in my setup due to lack of space so I am wired which is slightly inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: With the much higher cost than comparable gaming mice, I don't feel this mouse is worth the cost. I had it for around a month before it just quit working. No, I am not hard on my gear. The mouse worked fine then I put it on the charger went to sleep and the next day it didn't work and never would work again. Might have just been bad luck but I have purchased so many Logitech items that took a beating and worked fine. Very disappointed in the quality of the product. The battery also doesn't last long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Drewh87

customer_reviews.title: Features are great. Latency/response is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Features are great. Latency/response is fantastic. I don't think you could tell the difference between wired/wireless mode. Battery starts not working great after some time... (had this for years). Pointer starts jittering... Reliability is an issue with this.
customer_reviews.author: MagicMan

customer_reviews.title: Wireless keeps disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: It took less than a day for me to start having problems with this mouse. The wireless disconnects every 20-30 minutes, which is extremely bad if it happens while gaming, which is exactly what this mouse is supposed to be for. The top row of buttons was also pretty hard to reach in a pinch and my hands are average size. For the premium price you pay for this mouse I'd expect nothing but the best and in my opinion Razer doesn't deliver with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jmitch

customer_reviews.title: The battery life leaves something to be desired as well but all around a great mouse that really improved my PvP skills in WoW
customer_reviews.text: Black paint wore off the numbered keypad on the side within weeks but all the buttons still work well. The battery life leaves something to be desired as well but all around a great mouse that really improved my PvP skills in WoW.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Smith

customer_reviews.title: It broke the next day after I've got it. ...
customer_reviews.text: It broke the next day after I've got it. I have had a simple iHome mouse for seven years now and the only thing it shows is normal wear. I replaced it with an iHome Nine Button Laser Gaming Mouse...
customer_reviews.author: Pavel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mouse, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Amazing mouse, very comfortable. Great for gaming with the number pad. My favorite feature is that you can use it wireless but also when you ran out of battery while playing you can just plug it in and continue playing. My only complaint is the software Synapse, can't seem to sync my mouse to it and configure the settings, but the mouse itself is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Minh Vogue

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: Best mouse I ever had. I can literally play one hand. Taken a whole week for me to get used to it but after that make you life some much easier with them 12 set extra key. Dont get the Naga if you never going to use all them extra keys and the time learning them. I would recommend the Naga Hex if you are a gamer. Much easier learn and for none mmo games.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: It's Epic
customer_reviews.text: I got this and I refuse to use anything else now. I have another wireless mouse I could use while this charges but I won't because this is so superior that the other mouse would just be annoying. Nothing can beat this. I don't care what anyone says its the pinnacle of mice. Everything other mice want to be but cant. It is premium and comfortable I love it. Just make a everlasting battery for it please :P
customer_reviews.author: Wowgamer93

customer_reviews.title: it's awesome. When it has issues
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's awesome. When it has issues... Razer's software seems buggy, and the Naga (which I have on a Razer gaming surface) occasionally seems to lose one dimension of motion for no evident reason. I've never had it fail while gaming; only while doing usual desktop nonsense. If this issue were fixed, this would be the perfect mouse. Not having to give up a mouse while it charges and not having to deal with battery packs is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: VaelynPhi

customer_reviews.title: BULL SHIT
customer_reviews.text: i spent A LOT of money on this mouse and the CABLE goes out, oh and you cant buy a replacement..... really razer? REALLY?! how about next time we skip the gold tips and stupid braiding and make the wire actually last a while. i had to repair the wire myself, it works now, but after paying so much having to repair it like that is just plain stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Markow

customer_reviews.title: Literally the best mouse I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best mouse I have ever had! Lasted 4 years through more abuse than it was meant to handle, without so much as a flinch oh trouble. About last summer it bit the big one when my dog ate the cable and I couldn't find a replacement anywhere. Just bought another one a few months ago. Highly reccomended!
customer_reviews.author: anarchysk8

customer_reviews.title: MMOusome!!!
customer_reviews.text: having the numeric buttons are essential if your playing most any MMO. So far no left mouse click double clicking like my old wired naga.. Having the ability to go wired/wireless is great! pluss the stand(charger) displays the mouse nicely.. I'd like to compare this to a Madkatz mouse... this is a 5 star product!!
customer_reviews.author: James K

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: This is my first gaming mouse btw. Overall i am very happy with the mouse, but the thing that disappoints me is the software with this mouse. The software is called razer synape 2.0 and there was not a day where this program has freezed or crashed on me. This is especially when I go into wireless mode, however when i go use the mouse wired there doesn't seem to be a problem ...
customer_reviews.author: Dong Hyun Won

customer_reviews.title: Was great until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine and I was pretty happy for quite a while. But then weird rubbing and click interference on right-click. No way to repair myself, had to bin it. So long, Razer, your software for OS X sucked anyway. (Still better than Logitech though)
customer_reviews.author: K.L. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality & Lackluster performance
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice aesthetics and ergonomics Pretty lights Solid software Multiple grips Nice packaging Wired or wireless operation Cons: Poor battery life (~48 hours on a full charge) Poor build quality (Cheep/flimsy plastic construction) Awkward numpad style macro buttons Looses connection in wireless modes
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect MMO mouse
customer_reviews.text: Was very worried to order a wireless mouse for anything that I do with gaming. But I figured it was worth a try since it has a plus in so you can use a wire if you want. I was replacing my older NAGA that took a crap on me after 3 good years and gave it a go. You can't even tell the difference if it was wired or not. On top of everything it was much much cheaper then buying it though any other site that I've seen it on.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: that this would be too fat for my hands to be comfortable. I was wrong
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands. I was worried by the images provided, that this would be too fat for my hands to be comfortable. I was wrong. It's tiny. The buttons are tiny. While I am sure I could get adjusted to the size eventually, my hands aren't terribly dexterous and it proved to cramp me during the adjustment period. So, I thought about it: do I really need 12 buttons? Kind of... but these are mapped to 1 though = on the keyboard, or the numpad. They require you to turn off numlock, and for people who are more comfortable typing out numbers on the numpad, this is unforgivable.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Blechen

customer_reviews.title: For wired use only.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for around 8 months, then the battery started to swell and became very difficult to remove from the mouse. The battery isn't covered under the same 2 year warranty the mouse is, it's only covered for 6 months. Which means you have the possibility of needing to replace the battery every 8 months and will have to buy 3 batteries during the regular warranty period of the mouse. If you are wanting this mouse for wireless use mainly then I would highly recommend finding a different mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Zach G.

customer_reviews.title: Used to be 5-Stars
customer_reviews.text: This used to be my favorite mouse. So much so, that I had 3 (one of the original, and two of the Epic). Now that Logitech has released the G600 (which I now have), this mouse just doesn't cut it anymore. The battery life is horrible, and the wireless doesn't keep a solid connection every day. Many days I would have to unplug and replug in the base to get the mouse responsive again.
customer_reviews.author: Naxia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for WoW
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was great! This mouse comes with many adaptable grips for whatever is comfortable for you. Also, it comes with thumb trainers so you can get used to your keybinds. It's hands down the best gaming mouse on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthea J.

customer_reviews.title: Love the mouse
customer_reviews.text: Love the mouse. Last mouse was the normal naga so I'm used to having the additional buttons and can't go back to not having them anymore. Only thing I wish was different is I wish the two small buttons by the mouse wheel where to the left of the left mouse click like it is on the regular naga. It's a lil awkward trying to push those buttons without readjusting my hand since I use those for teamspeak so I have to push them often.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: Great product Most helpful
customer_reviews.text: Well let me get to the the bad stuff first. Firmware is pretty bad because of razer snapse 2.0 wont open at times i would run as adminster. Also the gaming mouse wont respawn at times and have to restart computer. Nice feel i got very used to the palm grip due to my small hands they also have claw grips for huge or large hands and classic grip for medium hand. Very easy to change the battery and grips. Overall great feel macros really easy to set hot keys are easy to use learned them in about 8 mins scrolling is very comfortable. Great for both wired and wireless gaming also awesome looking charging station.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: While I *LOVE* the Razer Naga - this was the ...
customer_reviews.text: While I *LOVE* the Razer Naga - this was the second one I purchased. Each time the USB cable failed. Unfortunately the company does not sell or provide replacements. I finally went with the hard wired one and it has held up.
customer_reviews.author: lostNwords

customer_reviews.title: Worth looking at
customer_reviews.text: Razer gaming mice have always done me good. What stinks is the Best Mouse they had in their line up they discontinued. If anyone can find a Naga Epic mouse it’s worth getting even as old as they are now.
customer_reviews.author: ramon

customer_reviews.title: (son speaking) Great mouse. I find it funny how it's not ...
customer_reviews.text: (son speaking) Great mouse. I find it funny how it's not chroma but it still has like 40 color options lol. I think it is great it helped me a lot in gaming. I even dropped it a whole bunch of times and it still works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Berangere J Pierre-Louis

customer_reviews.title: Best Gamming mouse to date
customer_reviews.text: Best gaming mouse out there. I prefer to use it with the cord so I don't have to worry about it running out of power but works well cordless, as well. Lots of buttons to program/key bind. A nice tool for PvP or Ops to maximize your potential. And the fact that the colors randomly shifts between different colors is pretty cool, even my wife likes it.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: update on review
customer_reviews.text: now that I have gotten the mouse I would say that the box was a little bit too big for the product, since there was no foam or anything to keep from moving while tranported. The mouse itself is a 5+ star b/c it's ability to customize pretty much everything on there from its speed to the buttons and how u hold it. The only reason for the 4 star and not five was the whole shipping,which was the worst I've had since I've had amazon prime 3+years
customer_reviews.author: KRILLIN

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this mouse. After a month the ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this mouse. After a month the mouse stopped working. Would light on, and both left/right clicks worked but would not move. I tried both wireless/wired mode, tried all usb ports, and even uninstall/reinstalled drivers. I tried my old razer naga and it still worked. My only conclusion is that the mouse sensor broke, and of course it would stop working 2 days after return policy window.
customer_reviews.author: JThiel

customer_reviews.title: WE NEED MORE FIRM AND SMALL BUTTON LIKE THIS! rz01-00510100 razer naga epic, PLEASE COME BACK.
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE BRING THIS BACK, WE NEED MORE FIRM AND SMALL BUTTON LIKE THIS!!! NEW MODELS ARE THE WORST..
customer_reviews.author: D. Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Wireless??.....
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for almost 10 months now. I had a wired Naga MMO mouse before and loved it so much that I wanted the wireless version. Maybe mine was defective but the mouse does not charge with the little charging stand that comes with the mouse, so now I have to plug in the charging cable into the front of the mouse to charge it. Doesn't that defeat the purpose of a "wireless" mouse?
customer_reviews.author: dhenchey

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: this thing is expensive but it kicks ass. It changes color, it can change the body to fit your preference and hand and the buttons are programable and can use macro's so you can kill more things. now, who doesn't want that in a gaming mouse?
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is awesome
customer_reviews.text: razers mouse is very responsive. I had a microsoft mouse and it sucked. When you needed fast responses it was not the mouse to use. I have 3 of these I use on two computers. 2 on one that I play mmo's on and 1 on an old computer that i play a few old games that I can't play on my newer computer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetics don't work, sending in for replacement just after 3 days of use.
customer_reviews.text: The product works for what it is designed to do, move the cursor on the screen and allow you to click on the things. All of the buttons work as well. However, the LED on my particular model didn't work at all and I will be sending it back to the manufacturer for a replacement. I will warn you, Razer's customer support isn't the greatest in the world, as you could imagine. In addition, this particular model is considered one of Razer's "Legacy Models". Therefore, this is an older mouse and finding a replacement may be difficult. Something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse makes it possible to play your favorite games (particularly MMOs) without having to give up your movement keys for actions! I highly recommend it - even for casuals. You'll be surprised how much it increases your on-screen mobility and gaming aptitude!
customer_reviews.author: FriendlyNeighborhoodSatyr

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I've had the wired razer Naga for 2 years now and absolutely love it. When I saw that there was I wireless version I jumped at the chance to avoid my 10 month old daughter from pulling the mouse out of my hand. The Naga Epic was very easy to setup and I really like the software interface that allows you to customize the button and logo colors. However, after about 2 weeks of use I am having issues with the pairing. I have to re-pair the mouse with the base and sometimes that won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse ever
customer_reviews.text: Best mouse I've ever used. The wireless is more useful for desktops than laptops because the charging dock holds the transceiver, so it'll take up more space than the wired mode. The lights are beautiful and the tracking is amazing. It works on every surface I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Girl Incognito

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse
customer_reviews.text: this is the best mouse that I have ever had. It is excellent for playing games and I love the wireless aspect the most. It charges in the base while you are not using it and response very well. If you are playing a long gaming session you can plug the USB cable directly into the mouse so you can keep playing. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stallbaumer

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse but has its flaws
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse for my boyfriend and he uses it mainly for league of legends. The mouse is okay he just didnt really like the charging port and the usb. They could have done better with that. Seems like its made more for a desktop and not a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous0559

customer_reviews.title: Solid enough for MMO's
customer_reviews.text: It's made for a larger hand but the thumb buttons are great for MMO's. Takes some time to get used to.The button at the anterior lower corner can be a little harder to push in after it has been used for a few months. Wish this was made out of metal for the price but it is plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Over Priced for the quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in july and by november it had stopped working. I got in touch with customer service/tech support for Razer and they were not very helpful. I explained in great detail the steps that i took to resolve the issue. It does not work on any computer. I figured I got a lemon so I asked for a replacement and have yet to hear back from them. For an item that was pretty pricey I expected more reliability. In the short time i was able to use it it did work well and is very cool looking. If i could get Razer to replace the product I would bump my review up to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this mouse but I have had it less than ...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this mouse but I have had it less than 6 months and it no longer works in wireless mode. It can be on the charger all night and not work wirelessly for more than a few minutes. My nephew really likes the multi color lights though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Likes and Dislikes
customer_reviews.text: Likes: -it works -has wireless and wired option -has a cool docking station for wireless -wired mode charges the wireless mode -has the ability to choose the color of the led light Dislikes: -can not think of any at the moment
customer_reviews.author: Gianne Obrero

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is a computer science/game design major in college, and as you would guess-a rabid gamer! It was a Christmas gift and he was very specific about what he wanted. Personally, I thought the price was a bit steep for a mouse, but I decided "what the heck"! It's been about a year now since he has received the mouse and he still loves it! Believe me, it has gotten a lot of use (pc/Mac) and he hasn't had any problems. Definitely worth the money for a serious gamer.
customer_reviews.author: L.A. Markewicz

customer_reviews.title: Could Have Been Great
customer_reviews.text: First off the mouse feels like a NAGA mouse - I've owned the wired one for several years now and love it. This one, however, seems to have a ton of issues - the worst of which is connectivity. I've had multiple instances of synapse 2.0 just dropping the mouse rendering it unresponsive. This is especially tedious when it happens during a Raid boss. Avoid this one and go back to the older wired ones. The battery life is less than what Razer claims and, despite feeling better made than previous versions - the software and connectivity issues make a worse product.
customer_reviews.author: Fishnaught

customer_reviews.title: Epic. *Mic Drop* lawl
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing my old Naga Epic, after 8 years I finally wore out my left click... It would still click but couldn't hold that click any more :P Gamers mouse. I won't use another.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Snuffy

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Not too sure what everyone's talking about how this product breaks easily or ends up not working. I Bought this many months ago and it still works great on my Mac.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: Using for more than 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse for multi tasking. Sorry I'm not a big gamer but spreadsheet girl. Was looking for a mouse that can do macro. This is perfect. It did need a lot of setup to understand to use the mouse. But once u get thru it, it the best mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Clean eating girl

product_meta.title: Razer Naga Epic Rechargable Wireless MMO PC Gaming Mouse
product_meta.description:
RAZER NAGA 
View Larger  GET IMBA [AGAIN]
 The Razer Naga Epic is the upgrade to the original award-winning and massively popular Razer Naga. On top of its intuitive 12 button thumb grid, it supports wired and wireless gameplay and includes interchangeable side grips and multi-colored lighting. 

 IN-GAME MMO CONFIGURATOR 
 With Razer Synapse, the Razer Naga Epic allows you to easily organize your key binds and character abilities for any game by enabling you to fully remap and assign macros to all 17 MMO-optimized buttons. In addition, the Razer Naga Epic also features downloadable in-game addons and integrated in-game support for the most popular MMO games. 

View Larger 17 MMO-OPTIMIZED BUTTONS
 Effortlessly access more abilities and macros than ever before with 17 mouse buttons including the revolutionary Razer Naga 12 button thumb grid.

View Larger  5600DPI RAZER PRECISION 3.5G LASER SENSOR 
 The Razer Naga Epic is equipped with a 5600dpi 3.5G laser sensor to deliver precision and ultra-responsiveness to your game. 

View Larger  DUAL MODE WIRED/WIRELESS FUNCTIONALITY 
 Experience true gaming-grade wireless connection that allows you a greater variety of movement without any sacrifice of mouse control or accuracy. The Razer Naga Epic’s dual mode wired/wireless functionality allows you to switch between a wireless mouse mode to wired mouse mode – with zero downtime as you can still play while your mouse charges in wired mode. 

View Larger  16 MILLION COLOR BACKLIGHTING ILLUMINATION 
 The Razer Naga Epic features multi-color backlighting on the scroll wheel, thumb pad and logo allowing you to customize lighting to fit your preferences.

View Larger  3 INTERCHANGEABLE SIDE PANELS FOR ERGONOMIC FIT 
 Three interchangeable side panels designed by the world-acclaimed Razer ergonomics team provide an optimized fit for different hand sizes and grip styles, giving you maximum ergonomic comfort to last through those marathon gaming sessions. 

View Larger  RAZER SYNAPSE ENABLED 
 Enhance your Razer Naga Epic experience with Synapse, Razer’s hardware configurator with online cloud support. From sensitivity to lift-off tracking to surface calibration, you’ll be able to customize every detail. Better still, this data is saved in the cloud, so you can play your way wherever you are. Razer Synapse keeps your Naga Epic in peak performance via automatic driver and firmware updates so you’ll be on top of your game, all the time.
feature_bullets: 17 MMO-optimized Buttons - Access more abilities and macros with 17 mouse buttons including the Razer Naga thumb grid
Fully remap and assign macros to all 17 buttons. In-game addons or integrated in-game support for the most popular MMO games
True gaming-grade wireless connectivity allows greater variety of movement without any sacrifice of mouse control or accuracy.
Switch between wireless mode to wired mode - with zero downtime as the mouse charges in wired mode.
Three interchangeable side panels provide an optimized fit for different hand sizes and grip styles

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars817 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
